CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Loukis Loucaides;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant took part in the cleaning up operation after the nuclear accident at the GPE nuclear plant . He was subsequently registered disabled , becoming entitled to various social benefits , including the right to obtain a loan on preferential terms ( льготный кредит ) and free housing from the ORG .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , the applicant lived in a CARDINAL - room flat with CARDINAL other members of his family . The flat measured QUANTITY . In DATE this flat was officially categorised as a “ communal dwelling ” which gave the applicant the right to claim free housing from the ORG .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant requested ORG ( a bank controlled by the State – hereafter “ the bank ” ) to provide him with a preferential loan to purchase housing for himself and his family . However , he did not obtain the loan . Apparently there had been no agreement between the ORG and the banks regulating the allocation of such credits to GPE victims .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant brought proceedings against the ORG and the bank , seeking to obtain a preferential loan , as provided by the PERSON on the welfare of GPE victims ( “ the LAW ” – see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE decided the case in his favour . It found that the applicant , as a GPE victim , had the right to a preferential loan under section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW , but ORG had not yet signed an agreement with banks on the procedure for issuing such loans . ORG ordered ORG to secure the applicant 's right to the loan . That judgment was not appealed against and became final on DATE . The writ of execution was forwarded to the bailiff in GPE , and on DATE enforcement proceedings were commenced .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE ORG informed the applicant that the judgment of DATE could not be enforced since the law relating to the federal budget did not allow the allocation of preferential loans to GPE victims .

CARDINAL . DATE , referring to the lack of progress in the enforcement proceedings , the applicant requested the court to modify the operative part of the judgment of DATE . He sought to obtain compensation of PERCENT of the amount he needed to buy a flat . On DATE ORG modified the judgment of DATE ordering the ORG to compensate the applicant for the cost of the flat he would buy .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant purchased a CARDINAL - room flat in a house under construction from a developer . He paid MONEY ( RUB ) for that flat .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case to the district court for fresh examination . There is no information as to whether the applicant 's request concerning the modification of the original judgment of DATE was eventually satisfied .

CARDINAL . On DATE , referring to the provisions of LAW , the applicant brought proceedings against the municipality of GPE seeking an order to oblige them to provide him with a flat in GPE . On DATE the Presnenskiy District Court of GPE dismissed his claim . On DATE ORG upheld the district court 's decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought proceedings against the local municipality of GPE claiming free accommodation . On DATE ORG of GPE ruled in his favour and ordered the municipality to provide the applicant with appropriate housing for a family of CARDINAL within DATE , in accordance with existing housing and sanitary standards . That judgment was not appealed against and became final on DATE . On DATE the bailiffs initiated enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the municipality requested the court to stay the enforcement proceedings . They claimed that they had no free housing available to enforce the judgment of DATE . The applicant objected ; he also asked the court to specify how the judgment of CARDINAL DATE should be enforced .

CARDINAL . By a supplementary judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the request of the municipality . The court also held that housing should be given to the applicant under a protected tenancy agreement . The court further held that the applicant had the right to acquire the housing through privatisation in accordance with section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW . In the operative part of the supplementary judgment the court held as follows :
“ [ the applicant ] should be provided with housing either [ on the basis of ] a social tenancy or ... by way of transfer [ of housing ] into his ownership . ”
That judgment was not appealed against and became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant registered himself as the owner of another flat in GPE , which he had purchased some time earlier from a developer ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the municipality formally deprived the applicant of the status of a person in need of better housing . On CARDINAL DATE the municipality tried to reopen the case which had ended with the judgment of DATE , claiming that the applicant was no longer entitled to better housing . However , on DATE the court refused to reopen the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the municipality offered the applicant a CARDINAL - room flat . According to the Government , since the flat offered to the applicant was smaller than the one awarded by the court judgment , the municipality also offered the applicant compensation to cover the difference . However , the applicant refused to accept the flat and the compensation .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant was offered a CARDINAL - room flat . However , he did not accept the offer .
CARDINAL . On DATE the municipality provided the applicant with another CARDINAL - room flat . On DATE the applicant signed a declaration which was formulated as follows :
“ I declare that I accept , in execution of the judgment of DATE ... , ... the CARDINAL - room flat situated at CARDINAL , FAC , ... measuring QUANTITY .

Taking into account the decision of ORG of DATE , the flat should either be transferred into my ownership or the social tenancy agreement should stipulate that ... ' the owner shall transfer the flat into the ownership of the tenant at his first request . '
Otherwise I shall not consider that the judgment of the court is executed . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant received the keys to flat no . DATE , CARDINAL , FAC . However , it appears that another tenant had already obtained the title to the flat by that time . Thus , on DATE the municipality decided to allocate another flat to the applicant ( no . DATE ) . The applicant accepted the flat , and on DATE he signed a social tenancy agreement with the municipality .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Mayor of GPE wrote a letter to the applicant stating that “ flat no . DATE would be transferred to the applicant , free of charge ” .

CARDINAL . The PERSON on social protection of citizens exposed to radiation as a result of ORG explosion ( “ the LAW ” ) of CARDINAL DATE , as in force at the material time , provides that persons who were registered disabled following their exposure to radioactive emissions are entitled to certain social benefits . In particular , they were entitled to free housing , where their existing accommodation did not comply with minimum housing standards ( “ a person in need of better housing ” ) . The ORG undertook to provide such persons with accommodation within DATE of placing them on a waiting list . The same law entitled them to obtain preferential credit - an interest - free loan for buying or constructing a house . It also provided that MONEY of the amount of the loan would be paid off by the ORG ( section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ) , under the condition that they are in need of better housing .

CARDINAL . The PERSON of DATE on the federal budget for DATE suspended the application of section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW until DATE because of the lack of funds . In DATE the application of this paragraph was repeatedly suspended by the laws relating to the federal budget .

CARDINAL . On DATE the law commonly known as “ ORG ” was passed ( PERSON no . PERSON ) . That PERSON abrogated various non - monetary social benefits granted by the previous legislation ( free housing , free medicine and so on ) or replaced them with monetary payments . LAW ( CARDINAL) of that PERSON modified the wording of LAW . In particular , the right to receive preferential loans from the ORG was excluded from the list of social benefits to which the GPE victims were entitled .
CARDINAL . For provisions governing the right to “ social tenancy ” of ORG - owned housing see Malinovskiy v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL et seq . , ECHR DATE ... ( extracts ) ) .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure , a court judgment which has acquired legal force is binding and must be executed .
